snippet: The changes streamline rules that analysts say discourage small businesses from hiring workers and instead push millions of Mexicans into the underground economy.
abstract: Mexico approves broad changes to its antiquated labor law that will make it easier for companies to hire and fire workers; changes streamline rules that analysts say discourage small businesses from hiring workers and instead push millions of Mexicans into the underground economy.
lead_paragraph: The changes streamline rules that analysts say discourage small businesses from hiring workers and instead push millions of Mexicans into the underground economy.

headline.main: Mexican Lawmakers Allow Changes in Labor Law
